channel.title: One Tribe, Many Voices
channel.description:
World Music podcast radio show that features music of the African Diaspora.
Hosted by international recording artist Rasheed Ali.
Connecting the dots from Africa to Brasil by way of the Caribbean.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Rasheed Ali & Rain People Podcast Radio
channel.itunes:author: Rasheed Ali
channel.itunes:summary:
World Music podcast radio show that features music of the African Diaspora.
Hosted by international recording artist Rasheed Ali.
Connecting the dots from Africa to Brasil by way of the Caribbean.

item.title: Episode 129
item.description: This week we continue with the sounds of Samba. Brasil: The Many Faces of Samba Check out the play list / http://rain-people.blogspot.com Follow Rasheed on Twitter: https://twitter.com/rainpeople
item.dc:creator: Rasheed Ali
item.itunes:summary:

Brasil: The Many Faces of Samba
Check out the play list / http://rain-people.blogspot.com

item.title: Episode 128
item.description: This week we celebrate the Music of Brasil, the centre of the African Diaspora of the Americas. Featuring music from Mitoka Samba, Carlinhos Brown and Rasheed Ali & Rain People. The playlist is available on the 'One Tribe, Many Voices Blog. http://rain-people.blogspot.com
item.dc:creator: Rasheed Ali
item.itunes:summary:
This week we celebrate the Music of Brasil, the centre of the African Diaspora of the Americas. Featuring music from Mitoka Samba, Carlinhos Brown and Rasheed Ali & Rain People. The playlist is available on the 'One Tribe, Many Voices Blog.
http://rain-people.blogspot.com

item.title: Episode 127
item.description: The fifth and final installment of our Ramadhan Series featuring the Islamic music of the African Diaspora. This week we feature Senegalese legends Toure Kunda. Check out the playlist at the 'One Tribe, Many Voices' blog: http://rain-people.blogspot.com/
item.dc:creator: Rasheed Ali
item.itunes:summary:
The fifth and final installment of our Ramadhan Series featuring the Islamic music of the African Diaspora.
This week we feature Senegalese legends Toure Kunda.
Check out the playlist at the 'One Tribe, Many Voices' blog:
http://rain-people.blogspot.com/

item.title: Episode 126
item.description: We honor Ramadhan with Part-4 of our month-long celebration of Islamic music of the Africa Diaspora. This week we concentrate on the Muslim heartland of West Africa; Senegal & Mali. Music of Oumou Sangare, Salif Keita, Youssou N'Dour and more. Visit the 'One Tribe, Many Voices' Blog. http:rain-people.blogspot.com
item.dc:creator: Rasheed Ali
item.itunes:summary:
We honor Ramadhan with Part-4 of our month-long celebration of Islamic music of the Africa Diaspora. This week we concentrate on the Muslim heartland of West Africa; Senegal & Mali. Music of Oumou Sangare, Salif Keita, Youssou N'Dour and more.
Visit the 'One Tribe, Many Voices' Blog. http:rain-people.blogspot.com

item.title: Episode 125
item.description: We honor Ramadhan with Part-3 of our month-long celebration of Islamic music of the Africa Diaspora. Ismael Lo is our featured artist this week. Music from Senegal, Algeria, Mali and Nubia. As always visit the 'One Tribe, Many Voices' Blog for play list and more. http://rain-people.blogspot.com
item.dc:creator: Rasheed Ali
item.itunes:summary:

item.title: Episode 122
item.description: ("Not So) Distant Relatives"...Part Two: Cuba & Puerto Rico, foundations of the Rumba. Celebrating the power of the rumba. Featuring the music of Cuban master musicians Los Munequitos de Matanzas, Gregorio 'El Goyo' Hernandez and Los Nani, alongside Puerto Rican master Cachete Maldonado. Visit the 'One Tribe, Many Voices' Blog: http://rain-people.blogspot.com
item.dc:creator: Rasheed Ali
item.itunes:summary:
("Not So) Distant Relatives"...Part Two: Cuba & Puerto Rico, foundations of the Rumba.
Celebrating the power of the rumba. Featuring the music of Cuban master musicians Los Munequitos de Matanzas, Gregorio 'El Goyo' Hernandez and Los Nani, alongside Puerto Rican master Cachete Maldonado.
Visit the 'One Tribe, Many Voices' Blog: http://rain-people.blogspot.com

item.title: Episode 121
item.description: This week's show is called: (Not So) Distant Relatives, the first in a series of three shows highlighting cultural connections among the African Diaspora. Today, we kick off the series with two of the Caribbean's culturally influential islands: Jamaica & Puerto Rico. celebrating Damian Marley and Distant Relatives along side Cultura Profetica, Tego Calderon, Buju Banton and more. As usual, check out the 'One Tribe, Many Voices' blog- http://rain-people.blogspot.com
item.dc:creator: Rasheed Ali
item.itunes:summary:
This week's show is called: (Not So) Distant Relatives, the first in a series of three shows highlighting cultural connections among the African Diaspora. Today, we kick off the series with two of the Caribbean's culturally influential islands: Jamaica & Puerto Rico. celebrating Damian Marley and Distant Relatives along side Cultura Profetica, Tego Calderon, Buju Banton and more.
As usual, check out the 'One Tribe, Many Voices' blog-
http://rain-people.blogspot.com

item.title: Episode 120
item.description: Part two of Male Voices of the African Diaspora features "MenTell Stories of Love". Celebrating the so-called "Language of Love": Brasilian Portuguese. Music from Ivan Lins, Dori Caymmi and Rasheed Ali & Rain People. This show is a rare showcase for the Rain People sound as it journeys through Brasil. As always, visit the blog: http://rain-people.blogspot.com for playlist and other interesting inside information.
item.dc:creator: Rasheed Ali
item.itunes:summary:
Part two of Male Voices of the African Diaspora features "MenTell Stories of Love".
Celebrating the so-called "Language of Love": Brasilian Portuguese. Music from Ivan Lins, Dori Caymmi and Rasheed Ali & Rain People. This show is a rare showcase for the Rain People sound as it journeys through Brasil.
As always, visit the blog: http://rain-people.blogspot.com for playlist and other interesting inside information.

item.title: Episode 107
item.description: Special Headphone Mix: "A Day at the Beach". Relax and enjoy a day at the beach with Rasheed Ali & Rain People. This week's show celebrates the music of the ocean. Imagine yourself on an island with the music of Ruben Blades, Dori Caymmi, Flora Purim,Francisco Aguabella and Rasheed Ali with Bennie Maupin. The playlist and program notes available by visiting the 'One Tribe, Many Voices' blog: http://rain-people.blogspot.com If you enjoy the show, please pass it on and share it with others by clicking the SHARE button.
item.dc:creator: Rasheed Ali
item.itunes:summary:
Special Headphone Mix: "A Day at the Beach".
Relax and enjoy a day at the beach with Rasheed Ali & Rain People. This week's show celebrates the music of the ocean. Imagine yourself on an island with the music of Ruben Blades, Dori Caymmi, Flora Purim,Francisco Aguabella and Rasheed Ali with Bennie Maupin.
The playlist and program notes available by visiting the 'One Tribe, Many Voices' blog:
http://rain-people.blogspot.com
If you enjoy the show, please pass it on and share it with others by clicking the SHARE button.

item.title: Episode 100
item.description: This show celebrates the 100th Episode of 'One Tribe, Many Voices' ! Featuring a special conversation with legendary Global Village DJ; Simeon Pillich. Rasheed Ali gives thanks and appreciation to his podcast community that stretches from Beijing and Seoul to Germany, France and India. Check out the 'One Tribe, Many Voices' Blog for the play list and other cultural articles. http://rain-people.blogspot.com This is only part one of our Special.
